p: The MIC of crude Lavandula extract was studied by the micro broth dilution method and the results are shown in Table 2. Lavandula ethyl acetate extract at different concentrations inhibited all the growth of all bacterial strain broths. The MIC for E. coli was 6.25 µL and for S. haemolyticus, A. hydrophila, and A. salmonicida was 12.5 µL. Cronobacter sakazakii inhibition was observed at 25 µL. Streptomycin showed better MIC values in comparison with those of the Lavandula ethyl acetate extracts. MIC values are shown in Table 4.
